alert.note: Alert for Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 11:07AM CDT until May 27 at 2:12PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Republican River At Mccook 1se affecting Red Willow County. Driftwood Creek Near McCook 4sw affecting Red Willow County. Republican River At Stratton affecting Hitchcock County. Frenchman Creek Near Culbertson affecting Hitchcock County. For the Republican River...including Mccook 1se, Stratton, Benkelman 1sw...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Driftwood Creek Near McCook 4sw. * WHEN...From late tonight to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Lowland areas will become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 17.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 04/24/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1115 PM CDT.
